intro: Hieracium compactum, commonly known as the compact hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it produces small, oval seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium compactum is often found in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, and it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
